title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthias Kloft. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Björn S. Siepe. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kloft M, Siepe B (2025). intervalpsych: Working Interval Data Psychometrics. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/matthiaskloft/intervalpsych, https://matthiaskloft.github.io/intervalpsych/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {intervalpsych: Working with Interval Data in Psychometrics},   author = {Matthias Kloft and Björn S. Siepe},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/matthiaskloft/intervalpsych},   url = {https://matthiaskloft.github.io/intervalpsych/}, }

what: Working with Interval Data in Psychometrics
title: Working with Interval Data in Psychometrics
text: intervalpsych package provides toolbox analysis interval responses psychometrics similar disciplines. Interval responses can used represent uncertainty variability responses survey items, example. Besides transformation plotting function, package also contains wrapper estimate Interval Consensus Model (ICM; Kloft, Siepe & Heck, 2024) probabilistic programming language Stan. Results model can visualized summarized using functions provided package.

title: Working with Interval Data in Psychometrics
text: can install released version intervalpsych CRAN : can install latest development version intervalpsych GitHub :

what: Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
title: Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
text: function extracts parameter estimates consensus intervals fitted Interval Consensus Model Stan fit object class icm_stanfit.

title: Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
text: icm_stanfit object class icm_stanfit containing fitted Stan model. print_summary logical value indicating whether print summary extracted parameters. Default TRUE.

title: Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
text: list containing: df_rvar data frame extracted posterior samples random variables. summary summary data frame median credible intervals extracted parameters. item_labels character vector item labels.

title: Extract Consensus intervals from ICM Stan Fit Object — extract_consensus
text: function extracts parameter estimates consensus intervals fitted Interval Consensus Model Stan fit object class icm_stanfit.

what: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
title: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
text: function fits Item Response Theory (IRT) model using Stan.

title: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
code: fit_itm(   df_simplex,   id_person,   id_item,   item_labels = NULL,   link = "ilr",   iter_sampling = 500,   iter_warmup = 500,   n_chains = 4,   n_cores = 1,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   ... )

title: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
text: df_simplex dataframe containing simplex data. id_person vector person indices. id_item vector item indices. item_labels vector item labels. Can long format matching id_item vector unique labels ascending order. Default NULL. link character string specifying link function. option now "ilr", Isometric Log-Ratio function. iter_sampling integer specifying number sampling iterations. Default 500. iter_warmup integer specifying number warmup iterations. Default 500. n_chains integer specifying number Markov chains. Default 4. n_cores integer specifying number cores use. Default 1. adapt_delta numeric value specifying target acceptance rate. Default 0.9. ... Additional arguments passed rstan::sampling function.

title: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
text: fitted Stan model object.

title: Fit Item Response Theory Model — fit_itm
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df_simplex <- data.frame(matrix(runif(100), nrow=10)) id_person <- rep(1:5, each=2) id_item <- rep(1:2, times=5) fit <- fit_itm(df_simplex, id_person, id_item) } # }

what: Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr
title: Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr
text: Transform 2-simplex data unbounded space can modeled bivariate-normal distribution. done via modified multivariate logit transformation preserves symmetry interval responses conceptualized terms location width.

title: Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr
Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr
text: simplex numeric vector 2-simplex (3 elements sum 1) dataframe rows 2-simplex

title: Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr
text: numeric vector 2 unbounded elements dataframe rows numeric vector 2 unbounded elements

title: Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — ilr

what: Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr
title: Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr
text: Transform unbounded data back 2-simplex space.

title: Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr
Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr
text: bvn numeric vector containing unbounded interval location width dataframe rows consists vector.

title: Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr
text: numeric vector containing 2-simplex dataframe rows consists vector.

title: Inverse Isometric Log-Ratio (ILR) transformation for interval responses — inv_ilr

what: Convert from interval bounds to simplex — itvl_to_splx
title: Convert from interval bounds to simplex — itvl_to_splx
text: Convert interval responses interval bounds format compostional/simplex format

title: Convert from interval bounds to simplex — itvl_to_splx
Convert from interval bounds to simplex — itvl_to_splx
text: interval_bounds Data interval bounds format. min Minimum original response scale. max Maximum original response scale.

title: Convert from interval bounds to simplex — itvl_to_splx
code: interval_responses <- data.frame(rbind(c(.1,.5), c(.4,.7))) itvl_to_splx(interval_responses, min = 0, max = 1) #>   x_1 x_2 x_3 #> 1 0.1 0.4 0.5 #> 2 0.4 0.3 0.3

title: Plot ICM Consensus Intervals — plot_consensus
text: function generates plots ICM Stanfit results using either median bounds method draws gradient method.

title: Plot ICM Consensus Intervals — plot_consensus
text: icm_stanfit object class 'icm_stanfit' containing Stanfit results. method character string specifying plotting method. Options "median_bounds" (default) "draws_distribution". CI numeric value specifying confidence interval median bounds method. Default 0.95.

title: Plot ICM Consensus Intervals — plot_consensus
text: ggplot2 object representing interval plot.

title: Plot ICM Consensus Intervals — plot_consensus
text: function checks input object class 'icm_stanfit'. extracts draws lower upper bounds (T_L T_U) Stanfit object. method "median_bounds", function calculates median lower upper bounds generates interval plot using medians. method "draws_distribution", function checks number draws warns less 1000. computes consensus distribution item generates gradient interval plot.

title: Plot Intervals — plot_intervals
text: function creates plot intervals using provided data frame interval bounds.

title: Plot Intervals — plot_intervals
text: df_interval_bounds data frame two columns: lower upper bounds intervals. item_labels optional vector labels items. provided, length must match number rows df_interval_bounds.

title: Plot Intervals — plot_intervals
text: ggplot object representing intervals.

title: Plot Intervals — plot_intervals
code: df <- data.frame(lower = c(0.1, 0.3, 0.5), upper = c(0.4, 0.6, 0.8)) labels <- c("Item 1", "Item 2", "Item 3") plot_intervals(df, item_labels = labels)

title: Plot Cumulative Intervals — plot_intervals_cumulative
text: function generates cumulative interval plot based provided lower upper bounds, cluster IDs, optional parameters.

title: Plot Cumulative Intervals — plot_intervals_cumulative
code: plot_intervals_cumulative(   lower,   upper,   cluster_id,   truth = NA,   min,   max,   facet_wrap = NULL,   weighted = NULL,   show_quantiles = TRUE,   ncol = 3 )

title: Plot Cumulative Intervals — plot_intervals_cumulative
text: lower numeric vector lower bounds. upper numeric vector upper bounds. cluster_id vector cluster IDs corresponding intervals. truth numeric vector ground truth values. Default NA. min minimum value x-axis. max maximum value x-axis. facet_wrap logical value indicating whether use facet wrapping. Default FALSE. weighted optional vector weights intervals. show_quantiles logical value indicating whether show quantiles plot. Default TRUE. ncol number columns facet wrapping. Default 2.

title: Plot Cumulative Intervals — plot_intervals_cumulative
text: ggplot object representing cumulative interval plot.

title: Verbal Quantifier Data — quantifiers
text: subset data data collected Kloft & Heck (2024) containing probability interval ratings verbal quantifiers. dataset long format responses lower interval bound upper interval bound, respectively, one column.

title: Verbal Quantifier Data — quantifiers
text: data frame 3,344 rows 8 columns: id_person Unique identifier person id_item Unique identifier item name_ger German name quantifier name_eng English name quantifier truth True value quantifier applicable scale_min Minimum value scale scale_max Maximum value scale width_min Minimum possible width interval rating x_L Lower bound interval rating x_U Upper bound interval rating

title: Verbal Quantifier Data — quantifiers
text: https://osf.io/67vyj/

title: Verbal Quantifier Data — quantifiers
text: Kloft, M., & Heck, D. W. (2024). Discriminant validity interval response formats: Investigating dimensional structure interval widths. Educational Psychological Measurement, 0 (0). https://doi.org/10.1177/00131644241283400

title: Remove Zeros from Simplex — remove_zeros
text: function removes zeros simplex (matrix vector row sums one elements 0 1) using specified method.

title: Remove Zeros from Simplex — remove_zeros
text: simplex numeric matrix, data frame, vector representing simplex. row sum one elements 0 1. method character string specifying method remove zeros. Currently, "simple_replacement" supported. Default "simple_replacement". padding numeric value add element simplex using "simple_replacement" method. Default 0.01.

title: Remove Zeros from Simplex — remove_zeros
text: numeric matrix dimensions input simplex, zeros removed according specified method.

what: Convert from simplex to interval bounds — splx_to_itvl
title: Convert from simplex to interval bounds — splx_to_itvl
text: Convert simplex/compostional format interval bound format

title: Convert from simplex to interval bounds — splx_to_itvl
Convert from simplex to interval bounds — splx_to_itvl
text: simplex Data simplex/compositional format. min Minimum original response scale. max Maximum original response scale.

title: Convert from simplex to interval bounds — splx_to_itvl
code: responses <- data.frame(rbind(c(.1,.5,.4), c(.3,.4,.3))) splx_to_itvl(responses, min = 0, max = 1) #>   x_lo x_up #> 1  0.1  0.6 #> 2  0.3  0.7

what: Custom ggplot2 Theme for intervalpsych — theme_itm
title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for intervalpsych — theme_itm
text: function creates custom ggplot2 theme intervalpsych visualizations.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for intervalpsych — theme_itm
Custom ggplot2 Theme for intervalpsych — theme_itm
text: hide_axis_text_y Logical. TRUE, y-axis text ticks hidden. Default FALSE. base_size Numeric. Base font size theme. Default 12.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme for intervalpsych — theme_itm
text: ggplot2 theme object.
